image_1.description: The image is a collage of twelve photographs, each depicting different residential buildings. The buildings vary in architectural style and condition. Some are standalone houses with front yards, while others are multi-story apartment buildings. The colors of the buildings range from light beige to dark brown, with some having brick exteriors and others painted in various shades. Several buildings have fences or gates in front, and some have parked cars or motorcycles. The overall atmosphere conveyed by the image is that of a diverse urban neighborhood with a mix of older and newer structures. The caption indicates that these buildings are part of Sanford Solny’s real estate portfolio in Brooklyn.

image_2.description: The image captures a scene at the Lincoln Memorial in Washington, D.C., during a sunny day. In the foreground, two individuals are resting on the steps of the memorial. One person is lying down with their legs stretched out and hands behind their head, wearing sunglasses and a white top. The other person is sitting with their back to the camera, wearing a light-colored shirt. The background features the iconic Washington Monument and the U.S. Capitol building, framed by the columns of the Lincoln Memorial. The reflecting pool is visible in front of the monument, and the National Mall is bustling with people enjoying the sunny weather. American flags are lined up along the path leading to the monument, adding to the patriotic atmosphere. The overall mood of the image conveys a sense of relaxation and leisure, as visitors take a break from the heat under the shade of the memorial's columns.

The election could give the state’s Republican-controlled Legislature authority to pass new abortion limits or to outlaw the procedure entirely, potentially reshaping the map of abortion access in the nation’s center. The vote, which has been planned since last year but took on far higher stakes after the federal right to abortion was eliminated, is expected to send a message far beyond Kansas as politicians nationwide weigh new abortion measures and watch for signs of how the public is reacting. Lawmakers Could Gain Authority for Ban or Further Limits By MITCH SMITH
image_3.description: The image depicts three individuals sitting outside a building that appears to be in a state of disrepair. The man on the left is wearing a dark jacket over a black shirt and has short, graying hair. He is seated with his arms resting on his knees, appearing relaxed but somewhat contemplative. The woman in the middle is dressed in a red jacket with a floral pattern and has white hair. She is also seated and seems to be engaged in conversation or thought. To the right, another woman is seated, wearing a gray jacket and glasses, and appears to be focused on something in her hands, possibly a piece of paper or a small object. In front of them is a table cluttered with various items, including bowls, cups, and what appears to be food packaging. The background shows a worn-out wall with peeling paint and some greenery growing along it. The overall atmosphere suggests a moment of rest or pause, possibly in a setting affected by conflict or hardship.
